summary: Timeline_10 follows a journey through PTSD treatment with increasing use of coping strategies.

posts.text: Side effects are awful. I deserve to suffer I can't see a future for myself Sticking with it because my doctor said it takes time. used my DBT skills Noticing small improvements in my mood. I deserve to get better
maladaptive_evidence: I can't see a future for myself
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Thought I was getting better but I'm not. I'm broken beyond repair Back to square one. I pushed everyone away Reminded myself that recovery isn't linear. reached out to my therapist Reaching out for support instead of giving up. I'm not giving up
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: The constant worry is exhausting. I feel completely hopeless I can't focus on anything. I'm spiraling out of control My therapist recommended meditation so I reached out to my therapist and Taking it one day at a time
adaptive_evidence: Taking it one day at a time
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: The depression is getting worse. I hate myself so much I stopped taking my medication I know I need help so I talked to a friend about what I'm going through My therapist suggested I'm worth the effort
adaptive_evidence: talked to a friend about what I'm going through
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Starting to see the light at the end of the tunnel. joined a support group Therapy is really helping. I'm committed to my recovery Still have rough days. I'm a burden to everyone But they're getting less frequent. I don't care about anything anymore
maladaptive_evidence: I don't care about anything anymore
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Three weeks without self-harming. did some self-care activities So proud of myself. Recovery is a journey, not a destination Almost slipped up. I'm broken beyond repair But I reached out for help instead. Recovery is a journey, not a destination
adaptive_evidence: Recovery is a journey, not a destination
posts.summary: Post shows active coping and progress despite challenges

posts.text: I feel so alone. I want to give up on everything Nobody understands what I'm going through. I'm completely numb Decided to join a support group. reached out to my therapist Met some people who actually get it. I acknowledge my progress
maladaptive_evidence: I want to give up on everything
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Side effects are awful. I'm broken beyond repair I stopped taking my medication Sticking with it because my doctor said it takes time. called the crisis hotline Noticing small improvements in my mood. I'm building a support system
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: I relapsed again last night. I'm broken beyond repair I hate myself for it. I'm spiraling out of control Called my therapist this morning joined a support group and we talked through it. I'm being patient with myself
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: The constant worry is exhausting. I deserve to suffer I can't focus on anything. I've been having suicidal thoughts My therapist recommended meditation so I practiced my coping strategies and Things can get better
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Work is overwhelming me. I feel empty inside I'm on the verge of a breakdown. I gave up trying Talked to my manager about reducing my workload. practiced my coping strategies Taking a mental health day tomorrow. I'm learning to be kinder to myself
adaptive_evidence: I'm learning to be kinder to myself
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Thought I was getting better but I'm not. Everyone would be better off without me Back to square one. I can't get out of bed anymore Reminded myself that recovery isn't linear. wrote in my journal Reaching out for support instead of giving up. I acknowledge my progress
maladaptive_evidence: Everyone would be better off without me
I can't get out of bed anymore
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping
